alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued March 22 at 3:18PM MDT until March 23 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...West winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County, North Snowy Range Foothills, South Laramie Range and South Laramie Range Foothills. * WHEN...From this evening through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight or high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. Blowing and drifting snow could also reduce visibility to below one-mile.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
